title: 6 forgotten age-old Ayurvedic rituals for newborn babies | The Times of India
description: The coronavirus pandemic has taken us back to our Ayurvedic medicinal system.
cleaned_text: newborn babies The coronavirus pandemic has taken us back to our Ayurvedic medicinal system. From having kadha every day to including several herbs and spices in our diet, we all are relying on Ayurvedic remedies to boost our immunity. Ayurveda can improve our health in ways more than one. In this article, we will talk about how age-old Ayurvedic rituals can be beneficial for your baby. The birth of a baby is the watershed moment that changes the course of our lives. Along with the celebration, all the focus is on giving the best care to the newborn. It is also equally important to take care of the new mom who is experiencing all this for the first time. She too needs attention and care from the people around her. Here is a list of customs and traditions that are age-old and highly trusted. These lifestyle recommendations were an important part of the earlier Ayurvedic lifestyle. However, we would like to make it clear that these are not a substitute for medical advice. [readmore](javascript://) 02/8Soft words, soft music and gentle action The baby cannot speak but experiences fear and anxiety just like adults. One must speak softly to the baby. Make sure not to jerk the baby when he is sleeping or be very loud while sitting near him. Sometimes, the common playful gesture of tossing a baby in the air can create fear in the baby's mind, thus it must be avoided. Play gentle music or sing lullabies till the baby is one year old and do not leave the baby unattended. Harsh and loud words should be avoided in front of the baby. [readmore](javascript://) 03/8Limiting access to the baby Traditionally the newborn baby was kept in a separate nursery or in a separate room in the house and the only person allowed to access the baby was the mother or other elderly females of the family. This was done to prevent people from touching the baby and reducing the risk of infection. Baby's immunity is not developed until the third or fourth month and that is why taking this step is deemed necessary. [readmore](javascript://) 04/8Upward oil massage The umbilical cord takes around 15 days to dry and fall off, only after which one should start massaging the baby. Ayurveda recommends using ashwagandha, shalparni, the root of the castor plant, castor oil, sesame oil, turmeric and goat milk for massaging the baby. Ashwagandha in sesame oil or mustard oil used to be applied to the baby in the reverse direction, which was called udhwartana. [readmore](javascript://) 05/8Fumigating baby's room This was another age-old tradition where it was ensured that the baby gets the best environment in his room. For this, the baby's room was fumigated with ayurvedic resins and leaves to counter negative energies and infuse positivity in the room. Brahmi, heeng, gugulu and jatamansi can be used to fumigate a baby's room and clothes. This also helps by neutralising the germs in the air. [readmore](javascript://) 06/8Keeping the baby indoors until the fourth month As per Ayurveda, the baby should be kept only within the room till he is four months. The access should be limited for this room. Traditionally the day the baby completes his fourth month, he is bathed, made to wear new clothes and brought out of the nursery. The elders of the house bless the baby and once this is done, the baby is taken to other rooms of the house. [readmore](javascript://) 07/8Exposure to sun and moon The sun and moonlight have various health benefits that the baby needs during the initial months. The baby is kept inside the room for four months with only one exception where the baby is shown the morning sunlight for a few minutes. This sometimes can also be done while staying in the room, if there is a window from where the morning sunlight comes in. Similarly, the moonlight is also beneficial for the baby nervous system and helps in balancing the gynaecological cycle of the mother. [readmore](javascript://) 08/8Note Ayurveda is a vast sea of knowledge that deals with different aspects of life. Ayurveda can help enhance your life in ways more than one. When it comes to your baby, you can talk to an Ayurvedic expert for any personalised advice. - Do not forget to consult a medical professional if your baby faces any medical problems.
